## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}

```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

```{r}
library(stars)
library(sf)
library(tidyverse)
library(osmextract)
library(tigris)
```
```{r}
access_poly <- st_read("DC_access.geojson", quiet=TRUE)

access_raster <- st_rasterize(access_poly["accessibility"], 
                              nx = 100, ny = 100) 
plot(access_raster)
```
```{r}
DC_city_limits <- places("Washington") %>%
  filter(NAME == "District of Columbia") 

DC_file <- oe_match("District of Columbia", quiet = TRUE)

DC_streets <- oe_read(DC_file$url, 
                   provider = "openstreetmap_fr", 
                   download_directory = "networks", 
                   layer = "lines", 
                   quiet = TRUE) %>%
  filter(!is.na(highway)) %>%
  st_transform(crs = st_crs(DC_city_limits)) %>%
  st_filter(DC_city_limits)

ggplot(DC_streets) +
  geom_stars(data = access_raster) +
  geom_sf(color = "white", alpha = 0.1) +
  scale_fill_viridis_c(na.value = NA, 
                       option="A",
                       name = "Pedestrian access to\ntransit stops") +
  theme_void()
```
```{r}
access_points <- st_as_sf(access_raster, as_points = TRUE)

ggplot(DC_streets) +
  geom_sf(data = access_points, aes(color = accessibility), size = 0.1) +
  scale_color_viridis_c(na.value = NA, 
                       option="A",
                       name = "Pedestrian access to\ntransit stops") +
  theme_void()
```

```{r}
access_poly2 <- st_as_sf(access_raster, as_points = FALSE, merge = TRUE)

ggplot(DC_streets) +
  geom_sf(data = access_poly2, aes(fill = accessibility), color = 'gray') +
  scale_fill_viridis_c(na.value = NA, 
                       option="A",
                       name = "Pedestrian access to\ntransit stops") +
  theme_void()
```
```{r}
access_contours <- st_contour(access_raster, contour_lines = TRUE, 
                              breaks = c(0,2,4,6,8))

ggplot(DC_streets) +
  geom_sf(color = "gray") +
  geom_sf(data = access_contours, aes(color = accessibility), fill = NA) +
  scale_color_viridis_c(na.value = NA, 
                       option="A",
                       breaks = c(0,2,4,6,8),
                       name = "Pedestrian access to\ntransit stops") +
  theme_void()
```
